lines.text: [Frank is admiring a waitress's ass]
She's got a great backyard.
I don't know. I've never been to her house.
She's got a great ass.
You don't have that problem, pal?
Which problem?
With your cucumber.
I don't eat cucumbers, I always eat these bacon sandwiches.
[a very drunk Frank singing in the park]

I'm sweet Willy McGhee, I set sail for the sea / A man fit for sailin', my cock's fit for whalin', my balls they weigh seventy pounds apiece! / If you know any ladies, that want to make babies, send them to see Willy McGhee.
Take out your pecker and feed the Fish.
What?
Pee in the ocean.

[as Frank flies past Walter and takes a running jump from the boat into the lake]
You're naked, Frank.
You never went skinny-dipping when you were a kid?
Yes, but I wore a bathing suit.
I got a book and a bottle of whisky. I think I'll take them to the park and see which one I finish first.
I'll bet on the bottle.
I wouldn't bet against you.

[to Walter]
You know you answer questions that nobody asks. You're a lot like a woman.
I'm sober enough to know I was drunk.

[to Walter]
You've never said hello to a woman. How are you going to say goodbye?
It's a sorry sea captain who has no whisky.
You gotta have a partner to dance.
You know, Walt, I've been married and divorced four times. I got lots of enemies, but I'm kind of short on friends.
You have to pee too?
I'm 75 years old. I always have to pee.
that's life, Walt... that's what life does to you.
